image.altText: A man looks into the camera wearing a read and black sports club shirt.

props.synopsis: Tiwi Bombers are bouncing back from the brink, turning on electrifying performances in the NT Football League. A former Richmond Tiger is giving them a hand.

title.children: After retiring from the Richmond Tigers, this controversial former AFL star is helping a remote NT footy team bounce back

image.altText: Darwin Local Court

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old who allegedly caused “extremely serious injuries” using an edged weapon has been released on bail, with the judge noting a 12-month wait time for the matter to progress to trial.

title.children: First adult charged under NT government’s new post and boast laws faces court

image.altText: Exterior front signage at the Northern Land Council offices in Darwin.

props.synopsis: The Northern Land Council received more than $36 million in COVID-19 stimulus funding over a two year period – now questions are being raised about exactly where that went.

title.children: 'What I found concerned me': COVID-19 stimulus grants referred to anti-corruption agency

image.altText: A line of soldiers walking off a military plane parked on a runway, close to sunset.

props.synopsis: Experts say the next US administration could lead to a greater focus on defence in the Indo-Pacific region, and in turn, on northern Australia.

title.children: The next Trump administration could have a greater focus on defence in northern Australia

image.altText: An aboriginal woman

props.synopsis: The Kimberley region in WA's far north is home to more than 30 massacre sites where over 500 Aboriginal lives were claimed, but only three are officially recognised.

title.children: Beneath its tourist glamour, the Kimberley has a bloody history many visitors don't know

image.altText: A skink sits on a mountainous rock, orange and brown in colour, blue blackground.

props.synopsis: Scientists have worked alongside Aboriginal traditional owners to discover new a skink,  Liopholis aputja, in the Central Australian desert.

title.children: Scientists and Aboriginal rangers make 'exciting' discovery of new lizard species in remote Australia

image.altText: A smiling woman in a hat, sunglasses and work shirt stands in a stockyard.

props.synopsis: Stacey Chapman was born with a heart condition that should have prevented her from living her life to the fullest — and it almost did.

title.children: Thanks to the selfless act of a stranger, Stacey is back on the land where her heart lies

image.altText: A photo showing a Indigenous man wearing a grey Tshirt with green plants in background.

props.synopsis: When Lazarus Manbulloo was struggling with the loss of two family members in quick succession, he realised there was a lack of culturally-appropriate mental health services in regional and remote Australia.

title.children: Lazarus couldn't find a mental health service for Indigenous men. So he started his own

image.altText: Composite Shayna Jack celebrating and in yellow swim cap

props.synopsis: From vilified "drug cheat" to Olympic gold: The story behind Shayna Jack’s extraordinary return to the winner's circle.

title.children: ‘They just wanted to prove I was a cheat’: Olympian Shayna Jack speaks out against anti-doping system

image.altText: A steel ladder on the side of an outdoor pool.

props.synopsis: Gastro cases explode in 12 months, with the cryptosporidiosis parasite causing a large number of children to get sick.

title.children: Gastro cases in Australia have exploded. What does that mean for children?

image.altText: A woman with short purple and black hair stands solemnly in a medical centre with naloxone

props.synopsis: Since 2022, the federal government has invested $26.1 million to help make naloxone, a medicine that blocks the effects of opioids, widespread. Yet some pharmacists are still choosing to not stock the medicine.

title.children: As opioid deaths surge across Australia, pharmacists still choose to not stock naloxone

image.altText: A centenarian holds a photo of her young self while sitting her couch at home

props.synopsis: At 19, Margot McCormick quit working for her dad to join Australia's largest women's service branch — the organisation which paved the way for women to join the air force.

title.children: On Remembrance Day, 101-year-old Margot McCormick reflects on how she served Australia during WWII

image.altText: A young mother sits on the floor holding a little boy, both smiling.

props.synopsis: After giving birth to Henry from her mother's donated womb, Kirsty Bryant began showing signs of organ rejection before she could have another child. Despite the change in plans, she feels "so lucky" to have her baby boy.

title.children: First Australian woman to give birth after uterus transplant undergoes hysterectomy

image.altText: Workers in a broccoli field, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Has Australia made commitments to other countries that make it difficult for Australia to control its migration numbers?

title.children: How much control does Australia have over temporary migration?

image.altText: A finger pressed into the gap under a wall where the foundation has crumbled.

props.synopsis: A GJ Gardner Homes franchisee may have been trading while insolvent since early 2020. Then came more than 1,000 pages of complaint data about poor and defective works — but it was still able to sign up new customers for four years.

title.children: Things were about to go horribly wrong with a house build. But no-one seemed to be listening

image.altText: Joseph Suaalii holds his hands to his face

props.synopsis: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii impressed in what was the most highly anticipated debut for the Wallabies in over a decade, but that was only the start as plenty excelled in England classic.

title.children: 'I had so much fun out there': Former League star Suaalii makes dream debut as Wallabies thrill and delight in England stunner

image.altText: A flag with the colours of the rainbow flying on a flag post.

props.synopsis: Proposed changes to the Racial and Religious Tolerance Act will balance individual rights, free speech and religious belief.

title.children: Proposed hate speech laws aimed at protecting the vulnerable spark mixed response

image.altText: A closeup of two panting labradoodles with golden matted fur with round pink tongues hanging out.

props.synopsis: With Tasmania's government pledging it's "committed to improving animal welfare" in abattoirs, experts say all animal cruelty laws must be toughened or another "puppy farm" outrage will occur.

title.children: Another labradoodles outrage will happen without overhaul of cruelty laws, experts warn

image.altText: Baby boy smiles at camera

props.synopsis: The federal government will place RSV vaccines on the national immunisation program, as 12,000 babies are hospitalised with the virus each winter.

title.children: RSV vaccine made free to prevent thousands of baby hospitalisations a year

image.altText: a woman wearing a white jacket walks near a construction site

props.synopsis: Combined with the sluggish Chinese economy and persistent unemployment, pervasive age discrimination known as the "curse of 35" has led to a widespread feeling of economic insecurity among millennials.

title.children: 'They said I was too old': Chinese millennials lament the 'curse of 35'

image.altText: Princess Kate and Prince William clapping veterans at a remembrance day event

props.synopsis: To many fans' delight, the Princess of Wales is back to work, making an appearance at a Remembrance Day ceremony.

title.children: Princess Kate attends second official public appearance since completing chemotherapy in September

image.altText: A sunset over a rail line.

props.synopsis: If trains in Queensland's most populated pocket could be better connected through a cross-suburban rail line that already exists, why can't passengers use it?

title.children: Should Brisbane reopen this forgotten rail line?

image.altText: A grey card with the PTV and myki symbols is placed against a card reader which says the card has expired.

props.synopsis: Trouble is reportedly brewing with the US-based company responsible for upgrading Victoria's myki ticketing system, raising fears of delays and cost blowouts.

title.children: Victorian government denies company on the verge of walking away from myki upgrade

image.altText: A woman walks along the ocean, with a large skyline in the background.

props.synopsis: Qatar has suspended its role as a key mediator between Israel and Hamas, saying both sides were unwilling to negotiate "in good faith", as air strikes continued on Saturday in the Gaza Strip and Lebanon.

title.children: Qatar suspends mediation between Israel and Gaza, saying they are unwilling to talk 'in good faith'

image.altText: Soldiers carry a coffin draped in the Ukraine flag as a crowd holds flares in the background

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's presidential transition effort says a Republican operative who outlined some potential contours of a US-backed peace plan in Ukraine was not speaking on behalf of the president-elect.

title.children: Trump team distances itself from Ukraine peace plan outlined by Republican, as White House says Biden will meet president-elect

image.altText: The damaged engine of Qantas flight QF520

props.synopsis: A Qantas aircraft that made an emergency landing in Sydney on Friday could return to the skies as early as this week as engineers work to replace the right engine of the Boeing 737-800.

title.children: Photo shows torn and twisted blades of jet turbine on Qantas plane that was forced to make emergency landing

image.altText: A blonde and brunette women sit together, smiling for a photo. There are wine glasses on the table in front of them.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians go missing every year, so what's it like spending years grieving and searching for answers?

title.children: 'Predatory behaviour': Psychics accused of exploiting grieving families

image.altText: Port Adelaide players in a huddle celebrating

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide's first-ever AFLW finals campaign has gotten off to a solid start after the Power easily accounted for Richmond.

title.children: Port Adelaide creates history with first-ever AFLW finals win, setting up semifinal clash against Hawthorn

image.altText: A young boy in a school uniform

props.synopsis: Jack Davey died when a car crashed through the fence of a Hawthorn East school and hit a group of primary students.

title.children: Family and friends to gather to remember 11yo killed in Melbourne school yard crash

image.altText: Four men hold beers while smiling at the camera for a selfie while sitting in a stadium

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to Israelis who say they were attacked by people who asked if they were Jewish in Amsterdam after a match between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Ajax.

title.children: 'Anti-Semitic hit-and-run squad' attacks leave Israeli soccer fans scrambling to leave Amsterdam, vowing to never return

image.altText: An older man stands outside in an orchard looking at a cherry tree.

props.synopsis: Chiltern cherry growers Bill and Lois Hotson say customers are already placing end-of-year orders for the fruit, which is normally harvested from Melbourne Cup Day through to Christmas, and this season looks like a bumper crop.

title.children: 'Burst' of warm weather brings 'quite a good crop' of cherries after disappointing 2023 harvest

image.altText: Three men with rifles run through jungle

props.synopsis: Cut off from the world and mired in a deadly conflict, Myanmar is suffering from a forgotten war. But the ABC embedded with one of the many resistance groups who have banded together — and, against all odds, finally appear to be winning.

title.children: Through a muddy road, the ABC snuck into war-torn Myanmar. We found a rebellion ready to win

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump plans to heavily increase tariffs on Chinese imports, leaving many in China anxious about their livelihoods for the next four years.

title.children: China braces for economic strain as Trump's tariffs threaten middle class, manufacturing sector again

image.altText: Cooper Connolly has his hand checked out by a physio

props.synopsis: The tourists claim their first series win over the Aussies in Australia in 22 years, as the home side continues to struggle with the bat.

title.children: Pakistan claim ODI series in Perth with eight-wicket win
